So I have several designs done in 1.x for Avalon and it doesn't quite look the same. I also have parts that don't work the same. If you don't know what I'm talking about, click my signature and read on ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

So I wanted this poll so people can help me decide. I know many are waiting for more, I'm working on it! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Just go with the flow. Let the physics drive the story. Hey, at the very least it can provide some additional threads of inspiration. 

(Ha! Says me who doesn't compose much of anything ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) )

> 
> Just go with the flow. Let the physics drive the story. Hey, at the very least it can provide some additional threads of inspiration. 
> (Ha! Says me who doesn't compose much of anything ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) )

Yeah but the reason for rebuilding is I'm upgrading from an old version, I think it's 23.5, to 1.0.4. So lots has changed, and not all the mods and parts I used are in 1.x. So, there will be a newly built ship, I'm just trying to figure out how to maintain continuity in the storyline with a ship that looks different...

> 
> Yeah but the reason for rebuilding is I'm upgrading from an old version, I think it's 23.5, to 1.0.4. So lots has changed, and not all the mods and parts I used are in 1.x. So, there will be a newly built ship, I'm just trying to figure out how to maintain continuity in the storyline with a ship that looks different...

Personally I'd say try to keep it as close to the original as possible, and if that isn't possible/practical for some or all of it then I'd go with option 3 (storyline). Great story so far BTW. Looking forward to whatever comes next.

Yeah, I think that the ship should look as close to the original as possible. Having the ship suddenly change in the middle of the story would be a great plot hole, and I don't think that it's possible to make up a *good* story to explain how it changed (How'd the kerbals not notice it changing, how did it change, how could it change, kraken)

How about having them use some parts from the space-k craft they've found, to "mod" the Avalon? 

Then you could keep continuity with at least \*some\* redesigning. 

I love your story!

If it were me, I'd simply continue with whichever version of KSP that you're already using. Assuming you have the disk space to do so, you can just copy the lot into another folder and carry on running that whilst upgrading your original install of KSP. 

I have multiple instances of KSP 0.23 (with different mods added) , one of KSP 0.9 and multiple of KSP 1.04 (one for the Elcano challenge, one for my Science game which has different mods, and one in which I test mods on my systemm before using them elsewhere), and still revisit one of the games in 0.23 now and then where I had a nice little base set up on Minmus. Having put so many hours into getting it together, no way was I going to abaindon it. It's likely to be the first game in which I get a manned ship to Duna, I suspect.

Have the anomaly fire a transmogrification beam at ship, a la Calvin and Hobbes, it could add an interesting twist as the anomalies have been made out to be hostile so far, but would help the Avalon by transforming it.

![tumblr_ku8c43uVKl1qz7tiao1_500.jpg](https://6.media.tumblr.com/tumblr_ku8c43uVKl1qz7tiao1_500.jpg)

for me the most important is the story. The desing of the ship itself doesn't matter much to me. Plus, I'm sure the new version would look good also, even if it doesn't look like the original. Just go with a new design and pretend it was always like that! It won't affect the story, will change very little to the appreciation of the whole thing, and it will probably fly better than if you just tried to mimic the old one!
Another possibility is to keep Avalon exactly the same and disable heating effects to make it viable for reentries.

> 
> Another possibility is to keep Avalon exactly the same and disable heating effects to make it viable for reentries.

Yep. All you have to do is change the game difficulty.

Will OP deliver?
